trans-unit.source: Displays a single column header in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control.
A column header is an item in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control that contains heading text.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects can be added to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> class.

To add a group of columns to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> class.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Index%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> class to determine where the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is located in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> provides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.TextAlign%2A> properties to set the text displayed in the control and the alignment of the text in the column header.

To determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, you can reference the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ListView%2A> property.

If you want to copy a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> for use in another <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Clone%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> class with the image specified.
The index of the image to display in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> class with the image specified.
The key of the image to display in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Resizes the width of the column as indicated by the resize style.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.AutoResize%2A> method is only effective once the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> and containing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> have been constructed, and the column is populated with items.
If new items are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>, the column will not resize unless <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.AutoResize%2A> is called again.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeaderAutoResizeStyle"></xref> values.

A value other than <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeaderAutoResizeStyle.None"></xref> is passed to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.AutoResize(System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeaderAutoResizeStyle)"></xref> method when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View"></xref> property is a value other than <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.View.Details"></xref>.
Creates an identical copy of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> that is not attached to any list view control.

You can use this method to copy existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects from an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control for use in other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> controls.
An object representing a copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the display order of the column relative to the currently displayed columns.
The display order of the column, relative to the currently displayed columns.
Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> so the memory it was occupying can be reclaimed by garbage collection.
Always call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.
Otherwise, the resources the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is using will not be freed until garbage collection calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> object's destructor.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the index of the image displayed in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> property refers to the index of an image specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that contains the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> property returns -1 if there is no <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> set on the containing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The image displayed in a column is typically used to indicate the state of items in the column.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageKey%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> are mutually exclusive, meaning if one is set, the other is set to an invalid value and ignored.
The image associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is typically used to indicate the state information.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> to a value greater than the index of the last item in the associated image list, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> will be set to the index of the last item in the image list.
The index of the image displayed in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex"></xref> is less than -1.
Gets or sets the key of the image displayed in the column.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageKey%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> properties are mutually exclusive, meaning if one is set, the other is set to an invalid value and ignored.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageKey%2A> is set to an invalid value, an image will not be displayed, and an exception will not be thrown.
The image associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is typically used to indicate the state information.
The key of the image displayed in the column.
Gets the image list associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> returns the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> property for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that contains the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Gets the location with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control's <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref> of this column.
The value of this property does not necessarily correspond to the current visual position of the column header within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
This can be due to the user reordering the column headers at run time (when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AllowColumnReorder%2A> property is set to `true`).
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is not contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control this property returns a value of -1.

The zero-based index of the column header within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control it is contained in.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> is located in.
You can use this property to determine which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> object is associated with.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control that represents the control that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Gets or sets an object that contains data to associate with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains data to associate with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
Gets or sets the text displayed in the column header.
The text displayed in the column header.
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the text displayed in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
You can use this property to provide different text alignment settings for the text displayed in each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.
Due to a limitation in the underlying control, this property has no effect on the first column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, which is always aligned to the left.

To work around this limitation in [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)], you can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawColumnHeader?displayProperty=fullName> event and paint the column header yourself.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment.Left"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, if any.
This method should not be overridden.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, if any, or `null` if the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> is unnamed.
Gets or sets the width of the column.
This property enables you to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> can be set to adjust at run time to the column contents or heading.
To adjust the width of the longest item in the column, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> property to -1.
To autosize to the width of the column heading, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> property to -2.
Unexpected behavior can result when the combined width of all columns exceeds 32,768 pixels.
The width of the column, in pixels.
